visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing the relationship between sample size and chart rendering time using synthetic data extension with quadratic/linear trend modeling

title.text: Chart Rendering Time Optimization (Lower Values Better)

subtitle.text: Performance Comparison with/without Data Grouping (M1 Pro 16GB)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series with 12 quantitative observations each, comparing rendering performance across exponentially increasing sample sizes. Synthetic data extends original 6-point benchmarks using quadratic growth (disabled grouping: R²=0.98) and linear progression (enabled grouping: R²=0.96), maintaining domain-appropriate value ranges (60-12,000ms). The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by using continuous curves to emphasize rate-of-change differences, while Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through distinct hue separation (purple vs orange) and proportional line weights. Statistical anchors show disabled grouping exhibits μ=2,854ms (σ=3,842ms) vs enabled grouping's μ=178ms (σ=112ms), demonstrating order-of-magnitude optimization benefits. Axis labeling follows Tufte's quiet ink concept with minimal tick marks and D3-style metric unit conversions (k/M suffixes, ms→s scaling).
